Игра в которой можно (и даже нужно) отыгрывать несколько ролей за один матч. Ты можешь играть каждый раз по-разному, т.к. в игре есть куча навыков, с помощью которых можно "сделать персонажа" на любов вкус. В игре есть своя мета персонажей и навыков, но это никак не мешает вам выиграть с любыми не метовым :)
Также в игре есть негласные правила для убийц и выживающих, поиграв поймёте ;) 
Весело, затягивает. Всем рекомендую !

Игра для разжижения мозга, либо для поддержания его в стабильно жидкой консистенции. В принципе игрушка как раз подходит для современных молодых людей-глупых, необразованных и обозлённых на этот никчёмный жалкий мирок, построенный этими беспонтовыми взрослыми. ЗдесЯ можно чинить геники, сбрасывать палетки, светить фонариком, прыгать через окна и ломать крюки. ЗдесЯ ещё можно бегать за выжившими и бить их ножом и вешать на крюки. Всё.
Плюсы -... сама по себе задумка с убеганием от маньяка интересна. Интересно первые пару десятков часов, особенно против игры за доктора. Интересно и побегать за выжившими. Ну это тоже до поры до времени. Интересно поэкспериментировать с перками, хотя это делать интересно до 10 ранга...потом только мета. Плюсы всё.
Минусы -...убогий графон, баги, баги, баги, баги, вылеты из игры, убогая реализация интересной задумки побегать от маньяка и наоборот. Скучный набор маньяков и выживших. Персонажи как куклы. Дисбаланс против команд выживших, играющих друг с другом по связи. Невозможность написать слово negro в чате. Отвратительный матчмейкинг. Читерасты. Токсики, которых не наказывают за оскорбления. 
Итог-игра больше похожа на помойку для молодых дегенератов без будущего))) шучу, у всех есть будущее конечно. В целом если убрать баги то играбельно.
es muy divertido para jugar con amigos lo recomiendo

i have played this game for +1,8k hours so i figured i would finally leave a review for it.
dbd has a very unique game concept that, despite the repetitive nature of the game, never seems to get boring. infact, i found myself quite addicted to it and it is almost impossible to put down. the game receives frequent updates and plenty of new content, most of which is really high quality. like any game, dbd has its faults and there are a lot of continuous bugs and performance errors/issues that the devs neglect to fix. however, if you are just a casual player you might not have a big problem with them. and this is where i get to my main point; do not sink your teeth into this game like i did. it unfortunately gets quite grindy and it is easy to take it way too seriously, the toxic community represent that very well. you will quickly find yourself raging at the game and getting competitive to the point where you are not even having fun anymore (i am aware that this is the case with most 4v1 games or competitive games in general but i still think it is worth mentioning). i have found a lot of friends in this community but eventually cut them off for the obsessive behavior i just mentioned. so if you do get this game, stay a casual player and keep your distance from the community. theyre all just horny 16 year olds anyway lol

This game is definitely a good game. Even some of the people who review this game poorly have 2000 hours on this game. 
This game isn't a hide and seek game rather it's somewhat more like a fast pace chess game. Instead of trying to hide from the killer, the more optimal way to play is by looping the killer and the killer chasing the survivor both attempting to use mind games and reading each other's moves. What this means is that there is certainly a skill based game.

Some reviews complain about bugs, toxicity, and the fact that the devs seems to cut corners a lot. The first two are certainly true. There is always something broken in every update but there's never been a bug that has made the game entirely unplayable and it's rare for a bug to get close. For example, a common bug is sometimes survivors wont make grunts of pain but it either fixes itself next game or only affects one survivor (who doesn't have Iron Will). In terms of the devs, I can see where people see this but I feel like some people are just being overly critical. One example is breakable walls. Basically they are walls that killers have to kick in order to make a doorway they can walk through. Most people hate these and wish that the devs would get rid of them. However the devs keep adding them to new and old maps. On one hand yes, the devs haven't even acknowledge the hate for breakable walls but on the other hand, they are already being implemented and it would be a pain to go back and redesign maps to fit the removal of breakable walls so they are kind of here to stay.

One complaint that I do have is that to get the most out of this game, you need to buy most of the Chapter DLC. You can get the killers and survivors in the Chapter DLCs by just playing the game but it takes forever and you are stuck using not so great perks and only 3 out of currently 23 killers.
If you only have some money the DLCs I'd recommend to get are: 
- Leatherface (The Cannibal has the best perk in the game to unlock, Barbeque and Chilli) 
- Demise of the Faithful (The Plague is a pretty balanced killer and has some decent perks to unlock, notably Corrupt Intervention)
- Curtain Call (The Clown is bad, probably the worst killer in the game but he has Pop Goes the Weasel which another great perk.)
- Of Flesh and Mud (The Hag is a really good killer and has Hex: Ruin which is another strong perk.)

Luckily for Survivors, all the survivors have no special abilities and most of the good perks are in the base game.
If you don't care about having meta perks and just looking for fun, here are my recommended DLC
- Cursed Legacy (The Oni is a very interesting killer as his play style changes back and forth mid-game depending on your power state.)
- Lullaby for the Dark (The Huntress is the only straight forward projectile based killer.)
- Descend Beyond (The Blight is just a wacky killer and fun for both Killer and Survivor.)

Dead by Daylight: a social experiment on how progressively masochistic a team of developers can make roughly 80% of their player-base before they quit.

I used to enjoy streaming this game for 8 hour sessions because it was fun to play with or without friends; despite its frequent bugs, patches which seemed one-sided, and occasional toxic killer that needed under-handed tactics to get their beloved 4k to stay red-ranked. In spite of those circumstances: we kept playing, making the most of it, trying to get better with what we had left for safety/fighting capabilities as a survivor without being a total douche in the process; and all we received for sticking with it was continually broken hitboxes or poor hit regs, safety-nullifying killers, and more exploit perks to make the game miserable for survivor mains.
If you want to have some form of self-gratifying fun with this game: play killer. If you want to have your day wrecked by someone in need of an ego-boost, play survivor. In the meantime, I'm going to continue to contemplate the appeal of the "uninstall" button after almost 1000 hours and 3 years. 

I will say one thing though: it is truly impressive that a team of devs can make patches so progressively bad that you wish you could go back to playing the previous bad release.

Where to start, I first stumbled across this game a few years ago, I was watching Twitch and noticed a streamer playing it. I was immediately drawn into the whole concept of the game. NOTE: I have a soft spot for survival horror. The game is brilliant, its not without its faults, like a lot of games, but I find Behaviour to be quite interactive in terms of engaging with their consumers regarding bugs and issues. At it's core it's an enjoyable game that you can jump on and play for hours. I definitely recommend, especially playing with friends.

Como hacer una lasagna
600 g carne de ternera para guisar
300 g panceta de cerdo
1 cebolla
2 zanahoria
1 rama apio
200 ml vino tinto
800 g tomates pelados o salsa de tomate
50 ml leche
3 cda aceite de oliva
sal al gusto
pimienta ♥♥♥♥♥ molida al gusto
Pasta para lasaña
200 g harina común
2 huevos talla L o grandes
1-2 cda aceite de oliva
1 pizca sal
Bechamel
80 g mantequilla
80 g harina común
750 ml leche
nuez moscada al gusto
sal al gusto
pimienta ♥♥♥♥♥ al gusto
200 g queso parmesano
ELABORACIÓN PASO A PASO

Cortamos la panceta en cuadraditos pequeños. Pero primero quitamos la piel porque es muy dura.
Ponemos la panceta a fuego medio para que se vaya haciendo despacio.
Mientras tanto cortamos las verduras en cuadrados pequeños.
¡No olvidamos de remover la panceta!
Añadimos a la sartén con la panceta un chorro de aceite. A ser posible el de oliva.
Y añadimos las verduras.
Añadimos 1 pizca de sal.
Y, a fuego medio bajo, cocinamos hasta que la cebolla, la zanahoria y el apio se ablanden.
Añadimos la carne de ternera.
Hacemos el fuego medio alto y removemos muy bien.
Una vez la carne haya cambiado de color añadimos 1 vaso de vino tinto.
Cocinamos hasta que se evapore el alcohol.
Añadimos salsa de tomate o tomates troceados. Yo voy a utilizar los tomates que vienen enlatados enteros pero puedes utilizar la salsa de tomate que más te guste.
Una vez que la salsa haya empezado a hervir hacemos el fuego bajo y ponemos la tapa pero dejando un hueco para que salga el vapor.
La salsa hay que cocerla de 2 a 4 horas. Con mucha calma. Si ves que se está quedando seca añade un poco más de agua o de caldo
He tardado en cocer cocer la salsa 3 horas.
Salpiméntala a tu gusto.
Añade la leche para equilibrar la acidez.
La salsa está lista.
PASTA CASERA
La pasta la puedes comprar o puedes hacerla. Yo te voy a enseñar como hacer la pasta para la lasagna.
Tamiza en un recipiente 200 g de harina.
Añade 1 pizca de sal.
Casca 2 huevos grandes.
Añade 1 chorro de aceite de oliva.
Remueve muy bien.
Termina de hacer la bola con la mano.
Esta masa no hay que amasarla mucho. Solo integrar muy bien todos los ingredientes.
La tapamos y la dejamos en reposo unos 20 minutos.
Antes de pasar la pasta por la máquina la estiramos un poco con rodillo. Para más información sobre cómo hacer la pasta casera te invito a que veas este vídeo.
Si no tienes la máquina para hacer la pasta estírala con el rodillo.
El grosor de la pasta ideal es cuando empieza a transparentarse un poco.
Corta las láminas en tamaño 10x12 cm. Me han salido 17 láminas.
En abundante agua con sal cocemos la pasta. Yo voy a cocerla en 2 tandas para que las láminas no se peguen unas con otras.
Cocemos la pasta aproximadamente 1 minuto.
La enjuagamos con agua fría.
La colocamos sobre un paño para que se seque.
BECHAMEL
Para hacer bechamel derrite la mantequilla.
Añade la harina.
Rehoga la harina 2 - 3 minutos a fuego medio.
Añade la leche fría y haz el fuego alto.
Remueve muy bien. En la leche fría la harina se diluye muy bien.
La bechamel hay que remover todo el rato hasta que espese. Para más información sobre cómo hacer la bechamel echa un ojo aquí.
En cuanto rompa a hervir hacemos el fuego medio y la cocemos 2 - 3 minutos más.
Retiramos la bechamel del fuego.
Y la condimentamos. Añadimos 1 pizca de nuez moscada.
Sal.
Y un poco de pimienta ♥♥♥♥♥ molida.
Para que no se forme una costra la tapo con un trozo de film transparente.
Rallamos el parmesano o parmigiano.
Precalienta el horno a 180ºC ó 360ºF con calor de arriba y abajo.
Unta el molde o la fuente con la mantequilla. El tamaño de mi molde es de 24x24x6,5 cm
Cubre el fondo con la bechamel.
Coloca por encima una capa de pasta.
Por encima de pasta va el ragú o salsa de carne.
Rocía el ragú con un poco de bechamel.
Espolvorea con parmigiano.
Otra vez ponemos pasta, ragú, bechamel, parmesano y así hasta llenar el molde.
La última capa cubrimos generosamente con bechamel y espolvoreamos generosamente con queso.
Horneamos la lasagna 45 minutos, los últimos 5 minutos con grill a 250ºC.
Antes de servir hay que reposarla 10 - 15 minutos.

Absolutely a great game. Whenever I dive myself into this world, I am always filled with both joy and fear at the same time, which is quite hard to explain, but in fact this is what makes this game so outstanding. Not so many games out there can do the same thing as thus game does. It is fun to play, and it is even more fun to play with friends. But I recommend playing the game alone cuz it will push your stress level to the max lol :D . When you play as the survivors, you will have that feeling of cowardice, and itimidation, the opposite to the killers, you will feel much more powerful and cruelly savage. In a word., this game is worth a penny, give it a go guys. The community here is also huge as well. I totally recommend this master piece. Only with one hour in the game, i can say that i am wholely into this. Get myself through a couple of tutorial stufff and some blood point investment, characters, outfits, etc.
